poem:
**Mickey in the Stars**

Mickey, seventeen   
in the exiled ship,   
marking his path   
amid stars and satire.   
Pattinson's gaze,   
keen and knowing,  
with capitalism's herald   
Ruffalo, the voyager,  
as planets turn  
funny, sharp—  
a class echo   
whispered in the void,   
infinite space,  
where dreams curdle   
and reform.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mickey 17 to Belén: the seven best films to watch on TV this week Pick of the week Mickey 17 Bong Joon-ho’s follow-up to his Oscar-laden social satire Parasite is another sharp comedy about class and capitalism, this time set in space. A starship under the command of Mark Ruffalo’s Trumpesque politician is en route to colonise a distant planet. Robert Pattinson – who is becoming quite the character actor – stars as Mickey, an". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
